meanings.definition: To receive more votes than (someone or something) in a poll.
meanings.sent1: In the school election, Sarah outpolls all her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The popular movie outpolls the other films at the box office.
meanings.sent3: The cat outpolls the dog in the pet popularity contest.
meanings.sent4: The new restaurant outpolls the old one in customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent5: The sunny weather always outpolls rainy days for outdoor activities.

meanings.definition: To surpass in number of votes received in a poll.
meanings.sent1: The new candidate outpolls the incumbent in the election.
meanings.sent2: Her idea outpolls all others in the team meeting.
meanings.sent3: The surprise guest outpolls the main performer in audience applause.
meanings.sent4: The fresh produce outpolls the packaged goods in sales.
meanings.sent5: The talented singer always outpolls the other contestants in the competition.
